Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

Micah

SummaryThe book of Micah is a Prophetic Oracle. The prophet Micah wrote it 742-686 B.C. shortly before the Northern Kingdom’s fall in 722 B.C. Key personalities are all the people of Samaria and Jerusalem.The purpose of the book of Micah was to proclaim warning and judgment to both the Northern and the Southern Kingdoms. His message was similar to that of Isaiah and was written at about the same time. Micah described the impending judgment that would eventually exile the nation.

•    Chapters 1-5 specifically explain the judgment for the wicked nations, “For I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the open country, planting places for a vineyard. I will pour her stones down into the valley and will lay bare her foundations” (1:6). Then chapter five Micah miraculously predicts the birthplace of the Messiah in Bethlehem. Also in verse 2, he teaches that the Messiah is an infinite Savior, from everlasting, “But as for you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, too little to be among the clans of Judah, from you One will go forth for Me to be ruler in Israel. His goings forth are from long ago, from the days of eternity” (5:2).

•    In chapters 6-7, Micah declares what God requires of men, “He has told you, O man, what is good; and what does the LORD require of you but to do justice, to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God?” (6:8). Micah then proclaims God’s restoration and salvation to His people, “Who is a God like You, who pardons iniquity and passes over the rebellious act of the remnant of His possession? He does not retain His anger forever, because He delights in unchanging love” (7:18).
    Outline
  2. 1. First Cycle of Judgment and Restoration  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2:13 )
  3. a. Judgment of Samaria and Jerusalem  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2:11 )
  4. i.   Judgment to Come  ( 1:1⁠–⁠7 )
  5. ii.  Weeping and Mourning  ( 1:8⁠–⁠16 )
  6. iii. Woe to Oppressors  ( 2:1⁠–⁠5 )
  7. iv. Reproof of False Prophets  ( 2:6⁠–⁠11 )
  8. b. Restoration of a Remnant  ( 2:12⁠–⁠13 )
  9. 2. Second Cycle of Judgment and Restoration  ( 3:1⁠–⁠5:15 )
  10. a. Judgment of Rulers and Prophets  ( 3:1⁠–⁠12 )
  11. b. Future Restoration  ( 4:1⁠–⁠5:15 )
  12. i.   The Mountain of the House of the LORD  ( 4:1⁠–⁠5 )
  13. ii.  Restoration of Zion  ( 4:6⁠–⁠13 )
  14. iii. A Ruler from Bethlehem  ( 5:1⁠–⁠6 )
  15. iv. The Remnant of Jacob  ( 5:7⁠–⁠15 )
  16. 3. Third Cycle of Judgment and Restoration  ( 6:1⁠–⁠7:20 )
  17. a. Judgment on Israel  ( 6:1⁠–⁠7:6 )
  18. i.   The Case against Israel  ( 6:1⁠–⁠8 )
  19. ii.  The Punishment of Israel  ( 6:9⁠–⁠16 )
  20. iii. Israel’s Great Misery  ( 7:1⁠–⁠6 )
  21. b. The Final Restoration of God's Kingdom  ( 7:7⁠–⁠20 )
  22. i.   Israel’s Confession and Comfort  ( 7:7⁠–⁠13 )
  23. ii.  God’s Compassion on Israel  ( 7:14⁠–⁠20 )

1
First Cycle of Judgment and Restoration

Judgment of Samaria and Jerusalem

דְּבַר־יְהוָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֗ה אֶל־מִיכָה֙ הַמֹּ֣רַשְׁתִּ֔י בִּימֵ֥י יֹותָ֛ם אָחָ֥ז יְחִזְקִיָּ֖ה מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־חָזָ֥ה עַל־שֹׁמְרֹ֖ון וִירֽוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

1 THe word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which He saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.Micah 1:1
Stats
Rank: #6543 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 160 characters, 25 words, 127 letters, 48 vowels, 79 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דְּבַר־יְהוָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֗ה אֶל־מִיכָה֙ הַמֹּ֣רַשְׁתִּ֔י בִּימֵ֥י יֹותָ֛ם אָחָ֥ז יְחִזְקִיָּ֖ה מַלְכֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־חָזָ֥ה עַל־שֹׁמְרֹ֖ון וִירֽוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: the word of Yahweh that came to Micah the Moreshite in the days of Jotham Ahaz and Hezekiah kings of Judah which he saw regarding Samaria and Jerusalem

KJV: The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
References

"Micah"
Mic 1:14: 15: Therefore will you give presents to Moreshethgath: the houses of Achzib will be a lie to the kings of Israel.
Jer 26:18: Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah: and spoke to all the people of Judah: saying: Thus says the LORD of hosts; Zion will be plowed like a field: and Jerusalem will become heaps: and the mountain of the house as the high places of a forest.

"Jotham"
2Ch 27:1-32: Jotham was 25 years old when he began to reign: and he reigned 16 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Jerushah: the daughter of Zadok.
Isa 1:1: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz: which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah: Jotham: Ahaz: and Hezekiah: kings of Judah.
Ho 1:1: The word of the LORD that came to Hosea: the son of Beeri: in the days of Uzziah: Jotham: Ahaz: and Hezekiah: kings of Judah: and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash: king of Israel.

"which"
Am 1:1: The words of Amos: who was among the herdmen of Tekoa: which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah: and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel: two years before the earthquake.
Hab 1:1: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

"concerning"
Mic 1:5: For the transgression of Jacob is all this: and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?
Ho 4:15: Though you: Israel: play the harlot: yet not let Judah offend; and not come you to Gilgal: neither go you up to Bethaven: nor swear: The LORD lives.
Ho 5:5-14: The pride of Israel does testify to his face: therefore will Israel and Ephraim fall in their iniquity; Judah also will fall with them.
Ho 6:10: 11: I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there is the whoredom of Ephraim: Israel is defiled.
Ho 8:14: For Israel has forgotten his Maker: and builds temples; and Judah has multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities: and it will devour the palaces thereof.
Ho 12:1: 2: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.
Am 2:4-8: Thus says the LORD; For 3 transgressions of Judah: and for 4: I not will turn away the punishment thereof; because they have despised the law of the LORD: and not have kept His commandments: and their lies caused them to err: after the which their fathers have walked:
Am 3:1: 2: Hear this word that the LORD has spoken against you: O children of Israel: against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt: saying:
Am 6:1: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion: and trust in the mountain of Samaria: which are named chief of the nations: to whom the house of Israel came!

H1964 הֵיכָל hêykâl hay-kawl probably from יָכֹל (in the sense of capacity); a large public building, such as a palace or temple; palace, temple. 		מֵהֵיכַ֥לmê-hê-ḵal from temple Prep-m | N-msc

H6944 קֹדֶשׁ qôdesh ko-desh from קָדַשׁ; a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity; consecrated (thing), dedicated (thing), hallowed (thing), holiness, (idiom most) holy (idiom day, portion, thing), saint, sanctuary. 		קָדְשֽׁוֹ׃qā-ḏə-šōw. His holy N-msc | 3ms
2 Hear, all you people; listen, O earth, and all that therein is: and let the Lord GOD be witness against you, the Lord from His holy temple.Micah 1:2
Stats
Rank: #2084 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 139 characters, 21 words, 106 letters, 40 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ֙ עַמִּ֣ים כֻּלָּ֔ם הַקְשִׁ֖יבִי אֶ֣רֶץ וּמְלֹאָ֑הּ וִיהִי֩ אֲדֹנָ֨י יְהוִ֤ה בָּכֶם֙ לְעֵ֔ד אֲדֹנָ֖י מֵהֵיכַ֥ל קָדְשֹֽׁו׃

Lit: Hear peoples all you Listen earth and all that is in it let be the Lord GOD against you a witness the Lord from temple His holy

KJV: Hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: and let the Lord GOD be witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.
References

"hearken"
Mic 6:1: 2: Hear you now what the LORD says; Arise: contend you before the mountains: and let the hills hear your voice.
De 32:1: Give ear: O you heavens: and I will speak; and hear: O earth: the words of my mouth.
Ps 49:1: 2: A Psalm for the sons of Korah.>> Hear this: all you people; give ear: all you inhabitants of the world:
Ps 50:1: > The mighty God: even the LORD: has spoken: and called the earth from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.
Isa 1:2: Hear: O heavens: and give ear: O earth: for the LORD has spoken: I have nourished and brought up children: and they have rebelled against me.
Jer 22:29: O earth: earth: earth: hear the word of the LORD.
Mr 7:14-16: When he had called all the people to him: he said to them: Listen to me every one of you: and understand:
Re 2:7: 11: 17: 29: He who has an ear: let Him hear what the Spirit says to the churches; To Him that overcomes will I give to eat of the tree of life: which is in the middle of the paradise of God.
Re 3:6: 13: 22: He who has an ear: let Him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

"all that therein is"
Ps 24:1: > The earth is the LORD's: and the fulness thereof; the world: and they that dwell therein.
Ps 50:12: If I were hungry: I not would tell you: for the world is my: and the fulness thereof.

"let"
Ps 50:7: Hear: O my people: and I will speak; O Israel: and I will testify against you: I am God: even your God.
Jer 29:23: Because they have committed villany in Israel: and have committed adultery with their neighbours' wives: and have spoken lying words in my name: which I not have commanded them; even I know: and am a witness: says the LORD.
Mal 2:14: Yet you say: For what reason? Because the LORD has been witness between you and the wife of your youth: against whom you have dealt treacherously: yet is she your companion: and the wife of your covenant.
Mal 3:5: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers: and against the adulterers: and against false swearers: and against those that oppress the hireling in His wages: the widow: and the fatherless: and that turn aside the stranger from His right: and not fear me: says the LORD of hosts.

"the Lord from"
Ps 11:4: The LORD is in His holy temple: the LORD's throne is in heaven: His eyes look: His eyelids try: the children of men.
Ps 28:2: Hear the voice of my supplications: when I cry to you: when I lift up my hands toward your holy oracle.
Jon 2:7: When my soul fainted within me I remembered the LORD: and my prayer came in to you: into your holy temple.
Hab 2:20: But the LORD is in His holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before Him.

 כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה יֹצֵ֣א מִמְּקֹומֹ֑ו וְיָרַ֥ד וְדָרַ֖ךְ עַל־ [בָּמֹותֵי כ] (בָּ֥מֳתֵי ק) אָֽרֶץ׃

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj

3 For, look, the LORD comes forth out of His place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.Micah 1:3
Stats
Rank: #3372 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 117 characters, 19 words, 90 letters, 32 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה יֹצֵ֣א מִמְּקֹומֹ֑ו וְיָרַ֥ד וְדָרַ֖ךְ עַל־ [בָּמֹותֵי כ] (בָּ֥מֳתֵי ק) אָֽרֶץ׃

Lit: For behold Yahweh is coming out of His place and He will come down and tread on the high places of the earth

KJV: For, behold, the LORD cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.
References

"cometh"

Isa 64:1: 2: Oh that you would'>would rend the heavens: that you would'>would come down: that the mountains might flow down at your presence:
Eze 3:12: Then the spirit took me up: and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing: saying: Blessed be the glory of the LORD from His place.
Ho 5:14: 15: For I will be to Ephraim as a lion: and as a young lion to the house of Judah: I: even I: will tear and go away; I will take away: and none will rescue him.

"place"
Ps 115:3: But our God is in the heavens: He has done whatever He has pleased.

"and tread"
Job 40:12: Look on every one that is proud: and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
Isa 2:10-19: Enter into the rock: and hide you in the dust: for fear of the LORD: and for the glory of His majesty.
Isa 25:10: For in this mountain will the hand of the LORD rest: and Moab will be trodden down under Him: even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.
Isa 63:3: 4: I have trodden the winepress alone; and of the people there was none with me: for I will tread them in my anger: and trample them in my fury; and their blood will be sprinkled upon my garments: and I will stain all my clothing.
Am 4:13: For: indeed: He that'>He who forms the mountains: and creates the wind: and declares to man what is His thought: that makes the morning darkness: and treads upon the high places of the earth: The LORD: The God of hosts: is His name.

"the high"

Hab 3:19: The LORD God is my strength: and He will make my feet like hinds' feet: and He will make me to walk upon my high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.

4 The mountains will be molten under him, and the valleys will be cleft, as wax before the fire, and as the waters that are poured down a steep place.Micah 1:4
Stats
Rank: #3594 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 156 characters, 25 words, 121 letters, 45 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנָמַ֤סּוּ הֶֽהָרִים֙ תַּחְתָּ֔יו וְהָעֲמָקִ֖ים יִתְבַּקָּ֑עוּ כַּדֹּונַג֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָאֵ֔שׁ כְּמַ֖יִם מֻגָּרִ֥ים בְּמֹורָֽד׃

Lit: And will melt the mountains under Him and the valleys will split Like wax before the fire Like waters poured down a steep place

KJV: And the mountains shall be molten under him, and the valleys shall be cleft, as wax before the fire, and as the waters [that are] poured down a steep place.
References

"the mountains"
Jg 5:4: LORD: when you went out of Seir: when you marchedst out of the field of Edom: the earth trembled: and the heavens dropped: the clouds also dropped water.
Ps 97:5: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
Isa 64:1-3: Oh that you would'>would rend the heavens: that you would'>would come down: that the mountains might flow down at your presence:
Am 9:5: The Lord GOD of hosts is He that'>He who touches the land: and it will melt: and all that dwell therein will mourn: and it will rise up wholly like a flood; and will be drowned: as by the flood of Egypt.
Na 1:5: The mountains quake at him: and the hills melt: and the earth is burned at his presence: yes: the world: and all that dwell therein.
Hab 3:6: 10: He stood: and measured the earth: he beheld: and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered: the perpetual hills did bow: his ways are everlasting.
2Pe 3:10-12: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens will pass away with a great noise: and the elements will melt with fervent heat: the earth also and the works that are therein will be burned up.
Re 20:11: I saw a great white throne: and him that sat on it: from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

"the valleys"
Zec 14:4: His feet will stand in that day upon the mount of Olives: which is before Jerusalem on the east: and the mount of Olives will cleave in the middle thereof toward the east and toward the west: and there will be a very great valley; and half of the mountain will remove toward the north: and half of it toward the south.

"as wax"
Ps 68:2: As smoke is driven away: so drive them away: as wax melts before the fire: so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

5 For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?Micah 1:5
Stats
Rank: #3862 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 210 characters, 28 words, 158 letters, 61 vowels, 97 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּפֶ֤שַׁע יַֽעֲקֹב֙ כָּל־זֹ֔את וּבְחַטֹּ֖אות בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִֽי־פֶ֣שַׁע יַעֲקֹ֗ב הֲלֹוא֙ שֹֽׁמְרֹ֔ון וּמִי֙ בָּמֹ֣ות יְהוּדָ֔ה הֲלֹ֖וא יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: For the transgression of Jacob all this is and for the sins of the house of Israel Who is the transgression of Jacob is it not Samaria and who are the high places of Judah Are they not Jerusalem

KJV: For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What [is] the transgression of Jacob? [is it] not Samaria? and what [are] the high places of Judah? [are they] not Jerusalem?
References

"the transgression of Jacob"
2Ki 17:7-23: For so it was: that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God: which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt: from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt: and had feared other gods:
2Ch 36:14-16: Moreover all the chief of the priests: and the people: transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen; and polluted the house of the LORD which He had hallowed in Jerusalem.
Isa 50:1: 2: Thus says the LORD: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement: whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Look: for your iniquities have you sold yourselves: and for your transgressions is your mother put away.
Isa 59:1-15: Look: the LORD's hand not is shortened: that it cannot save; neither His ear heavy: that it cannot hear:
Jer 2:17: 19: Have you not procured this to yourself: in that you have forsaken the LORD your God: when He led you by the way?
Jer 4:18: Your way and your doings have procured these things to you; this is your wickedness: because it is bitter: because it reaches to your heart.
Jer 5:25: your iniquities have turned away these things: and your sins have withholden good things from you.
Jer 6:19: Hear: O earth: look: I will bring evil upon this people: even the fruit of their thoughts: because they not have listened to my words: nor to my law: but rejected it.
La 5:16: The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us: that we have sinned!
1Th 2:15: 16: Who both killed the Lord Jesus: and their own prophets: and have persecuted us; and they not please God: and are contrary to all men:

"is it"
1Ki 13:32: For the saying which He cried by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel: and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria: will surely come to pass.
Ho 7:1: When I would have healed Israel: then the iniquity of Ephraim was discovered: and the wickedness of Samaria: for they commit falsehood; and the thief comes in: and the troop of robbers spoils without.
Ho 8:5: 6: Your calf: O Samaria: has cast you off; my anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?
Am 6:1: Woe to them that are at ease in Zion: and trust in the mountain of Samaria: which are named chief of the nations: to whom the house of Israel came!
Am 8:14: They that swear by the sin of Samaria: and say: Your god: O Dan: lives'>lives; and: The manner of Beersheba lives'>lives; even they will fall: and never rise up again.

"they"
2Ki 16:3: 4: 10-12: But He walked in the way of the kings of Israel: yes: and made His son to pass through the fire: according to the abominations of the heathen: whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel.
2Ch 28:2-4: 23-25: For he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel: and made also molten images for Baalim.

6 Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of the field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, and I will discover the foundations thereof.Micah 1:6
Stats
Rank: #4047 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 188 characters, 32 words, 150 letters, 61 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֥י שֹׁמְרֹ֛ון לְעִ֥י הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לְמַטָּ֣עֵי כָ֑רֶם וְהִגַּרְתִּ֤י לַגַּי֙ אֲבָנֶ֔יהָ וִיסֹדֶ֖יהָ אֲגַלֶּֽה׃

Lit: therefore I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the field Places for planting a vineyard And I will pour down into the valley her stones and her foundations I will uncover

KJV: Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of the field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, and I will discover the foundations thereof.
References

"I will make"
Mic 3:12: Therefore will Zion for your sake be plowed as a field: and Jerusalem will become heaps: and the mountain of the house as the high places of the for.
2Ki 19:25: Have you not heard long ago how I have done it: and of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass: that you should be to lay waste fenced cities into ruinous heaps.
Isa 25:2: 12: For you have made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it will never be built.
Jer 9:11: I will make Jerusalem heaps: and a den of dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah desolate: without an inhabitant.
Jer 51:37: Babylon will become heaps: a dwellingplace for dragons: an astonishment: and an hissing: without an inhabitant.
Ho 13:16: Samaria will become desolate; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be dashed in pieces: and their women with child will be ripped up.

"and I will pour"
Jer 51:25: Look: I am against you: O destroying mountain: says the LORD: which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out my hand upon you: and roll you down from the rocks: and will make you a burnt mountain.
La 4:1: How is the gold become dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.
Eze 13:14: So will I break down the wall that you have daubed with untempered morter: and bring it down to the ground: so that the foundation thereof will be discovered: and it will fall: and you will be consumed in the middle thereof: and you will know that I am the LORD.
Hab 3:13: You went forth for the salvation of your people: even for salvation with your anointed; you woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked: by discovering the foundation to the neck. Selah.
Mt 24:2: Jesus said to them: See you not all these things? truly I say to you: There will not be left here one stone upon another: that will not be thrown down.

H2181זוֹנָה֙zō-w-nāh   (N-fs)
H2181 זָנָה zânâh zaw-naw a primitive root (highly-fed and therefore wanton); to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah); (cause to) commit fornication, idiom continually, idiom great, (be an, play the) harlot, (cause to be, play the) whore, (commit, fall to) whoredom, (cause to) go a-whoring, whorish. 		זוֹנָה֙zō-w-nāh a harlot N-fs

7 All the graven images thereof will be beaten to pieces, and all the hires thereof will be burned with the fire, and all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of the hire of an harlot, and they will return to the hire of an harlot.Micah 1:7
Stats
Rank: #3912 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 258 characters, 47 words, 203 letters, 78 vowels, 125 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְכָל־פְּסִילֶ֣יהָ יֻכַּ֗תּוּ וְכָל־אֶתְנַנֶּ֙יהָ֙ יִשָּׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ וְכָל־עֲצַבֶּ֖יהָ אָשִׂ֣ים שְׁמָמָ֑ה כִּ֠י מֵאֶתְנַ֤ן זֹונָה֙ קִבָּ֔צָה וְעַד־אֶתְנַ֥ן זֹונָ֖ה יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃

Lit: And all her carved images shall be beaten to pieces and all her pay as a harlot shall be burned with the fire and all her idols I will lay desolate for from the pay of a harlot she gathered it and to the pay of a harlot they shall return

KJV: And all the graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and all the hires thereof shall be burned with the fire, and all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of the hire of an harlot, and they shall return to the hire of an harlot.
References

"all the graven"
Le 26:30: I will destroy your high places: and cut down your images: and cast your carcases upon the carcases of your idols: and my soul will abhor you.
2Ki 23:14: 15: He brake in pieces the images: and cut down the groves: and filled their places with the bones of men.
2Ch 31:1: Now when all this was finished: all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah: and brake the images in pieces: and cut down the groves: and threw down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin: in Ephraim also and Manasseh: until they had utterly destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned: every man to his possession: into their own cities.
2Ch 34:6: 7: so did he in the cities of Manasseh: and Ephraim: and Simeon: even to Naphtali: with their mattocks round about.
Isa 27:9: By this therefore will the iniquity of Jacob be purged; and this is all the fruit to take away his sin; when he makes all the stones of the altar as chalkstones that are beaten in sunder: the groves and images will not stand up.
Ho 8:6: For from Israel was it also: the workman made it; therefore it is not God: but the calf of Samaria will be broken in pieces.
Ho 10:5: 6: The inhabitants of Samaria will fear because of the calves of Bethaven: for the people thereof will mourn over it: and the priests thereof that rejoiced on it: for the glory thereof: because it is departed from it.

"the hires"
Jer 44:17: 18: But we will certainly do whatever thing goes forth out of our own mouth: to burn incense to the queen of heaven: and to pour out drink offerings to her: as we have done: we: and our fathers: our kings: and our princes: in the cities of Judah: and in the streets of Jerusalem: for then had we plenty of victuals: and were well: and saw no evil.
Ho 2:5: 12: For their mother has played the harlot: she that conceived them has done shamefully: for she said: I will go after my lovers: that give me my bread and my water: my wool and my flax: my oil and my drink.

"for"
De 23:18: You will not bring the hire of a whore: or the price of a dog: into the house of the LORD your God for any vow: for even both these are abomination to the LORD your God.
Joe 3:3: They have cast lots for my people; and have given a boy for an harlot: and sold a girl for wine: that they might drink.
Re 18:3: 9: 12: 13: For all nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication: and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her: and the merchants of the earth are waxed rich through the abundance of her delicacies.

Weeping and Mourning

עַל־זֹאת֙ אֶסְפְּדָ֣ה וְאֵילִ֔ילָה אֵילְכָ֥ה [שִׁילַל כ] (שֹׁולָ֖ל ק) וְעָרֹ֑ום אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה מִסְפֵּד֙ כַּתַּנִּ֔ים וְאֵ֖בֶל כִּבְנֹ֥ות יַעֲנָֽה׃

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- On account Prep

8 Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, and mourning as the owls.Micah 1:8
Stats
Rank: #4111 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 127 characters, 22 words, 99 letters, 38 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עַל־זֹאת֙ אֶסְפְּדָ֣ה וְאֵילִ֔ילָה אֵילְכָ֥ה [שִׁילַל כ] (שֹׁולָ֖ל ק) וְעָרֹ֑ום אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה מִסְפֵּד֙ כַּתַּנִּ֔ים וְאֵ֖בֶל כִּבְנֹ֥ות יַעֲנָֽה׃

Lit: On account of this I will wail and howl I will go stripped and naked I will make a wailing like the jackals and a mourning like the ostriches

KJV: Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, and mourning as the owls.
References

"I will wail"
Isa 16:9: Therefore I will bewail with the weeping of Jazer the vine of Sibmah: I will water you with my tears: O Heshbon: and Elealeh: for the shouting for your summer fruits and for your harvest is fallen.
Isa 21:3: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me: as the pangs of a woman that travails: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
Isa 22:4: Therefore said I: Look away from me; I will weep bitterly: not labour to comfort me: because of the spoiling of the daughter of my people.
Jer 4:19: My bowels: my bowels! I am pained at my very heart; my heart makes a noise in me; I cannot hold my peace: because you have heard: O my soul: the sound of the trumpet: the alarm of war.
Jer 9:1: 10: 19: Oh that my head were waters: and my eyes a fountain of tears: that I might weep day and night for the killed of the daughter of my people!
Jer 48:36-39: Therefore my heart will sound for Moab like pipes: and my heart will sound like pipes for the men of Kirheres: because the riches that he has gotten are perished.

"I will go"
Isa 20:2-4: At the same time spoke the LORD by Isaiah the son of Amoz: saying: Go and loose the sackcloth from off your loins: and put off your shoe from your foot. And He did so: walking naked and barefoot.

"a wailing"
Job 30:29: I am a brother to dragons: and a companion to owls.
Ps 102:6: I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the desert.

9 For her wound is incurable; for it is come to Judah; he is come to the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.Micah 1:9
Stats
Rank: #4268 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 19 words, 86 letters, 38 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֥י אֲנוּשָׁ֖ה מַכֹּותֶ֑יהָ כִּי־בָ֙אָה֙ עַד־יְהוּדָ֔ה נָגַ֛ע עַד־שַׁ֥עַר עַמִּ֖י עַד־יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: For incurable her wounds are for it has come to Judah it has come to the gate of My people to Jerusalem

KJV: For her wound is incurable; for it is come unto Judah; he is come unto the gate of my people, [even] to Jerusalem.
References

"her wound is incurable"
Isa 1:5: 6: Why should you be stricken any more? you will revolt more and more: the whole head is sick: and the whole heart faint.
Jer 15:18: Why is my pain perpetual: and my wound incurable: which refuses to be healed? will you be altogether to me as a liar: and as waters that fail?
Jer 30:11-15: For I am with you: says the LORD: to save you: though I make a full end of all nations whither I have scattered you: yet will not I make a full end of you: but I will correct you in measure: and not will leave you altogether unpunished.

"it"
2Ki 18:9-13: It came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah: which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel: that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria: and besieged it.
Isa 8:7: 8: Now therefore: look: the Lord brings up upon them the waters of the river: strong and many: even the king of Assyria: and all His glory: and He will come up over all His channels: and go over all His banks:

"he"
Mic 1:12: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD to the gate of Jerusalem.
2Ch 32:1-23: After these things: and the establishment thereof: Sennacherib king of Assyria came: and entered into Judah: and encamped against the fenced cities: and thought to win them for himself.
Isa 10:28-32: He is come to Aiath: he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he has laid up his carriages:
Isa 37:22-36: This is the word which the LORD has spoken concerning Him; The virgin: the daughter of Zion: has despised you: and laughed you to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at you.

10 Declare you it not at Gath, weep you not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll yourself in the dust.Micah 1:10
Stats
Rank: #4154 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 95 characters, 19 words, 72 letters, 27 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּגַת֙ אַל־תַּגִּ֔ידוּ בָּכֹ֖ו אַל־תִּבְכּ֑וּ בְּבֵ֣ית לְעַפְרָ֔ה עָפָ֖ר [הִתְפַּלָּשְׁתִּי כ] (הִתְפַּלָּֽשִׁי׃ ק)

Lit: In Gath not Tell it at all not Weep in Beth Aphrah in the dust Roll yourself

KJV: Declare ye it not at Gath, weep ye not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll thyself in the dust.
References

"Declare"
2Sa 1:20: Tell it not in Gath: publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest'>lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice: lest'>lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
Am 5:13: Therefore the prudent will keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
Am 6:10: A man's uncle will take Him up: and He that'>He who burns Him: to bring out the bones out of the house: and will say to Him that is by the sides of the house: Is there yet any with you? and He will say: No. Then will He say: Hold your tongue: for we not may make mention of the name of the LORD.

"Aphrah"
Jos 18:23: Avim: and Parah: and Ophrah:

"Ophrah"
Job 2:8: He took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat down among the ashes.
Jer 6:26: O daughter of my people: gird you with sackcloth: and wallow yourself in ashes: make you mourning: as for an only son: most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler will suddenly come upon us.
La 3:29: He puts his mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

11 Pass you away, you inhabitant of Saphir, having your shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan not came forth in the mourning of Bethezel; he will receive of you his standing.Micah 1:11
Stats
Rank: #4368 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 171 characters, 26 words, 137 letters, 53 vowels, 84 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עִבְרִ֥י לָכֶ֛ם יֹושֶׁ֥בֶת שָׁפִ֖יר עֶרְיָה־בֹ֑שֶׁת לֹ֤א יָֽצְאָה֙ יֹושֶׁ֣בֶת צַֽאֲנָ֔ן מִסְפַּד֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֵ֔צֶל יִקַּ֥ח מִכֶּ֖ם עֶמְדָּתֹֽו׃

Lit: Pass by you inhabitant of Shaphir in naked Shame not does go out the inhabitant of Zaanan mourns in Beth Ezel is taken away from you Its place to stand

KJV: Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in the mourning of Bethezel; he shall receive of you his standing.
References

"Pass"
Isa 16:2: For it will be: that: as a wandering bird cast out of the nest: so the daughters of Moab will be at the fords of Arnon.
Jer 48:6: 9: Flee: save your lives: and be like the heath in the wilderness.

"having"
Mic 1:8: Therefore I will wail and howl: I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons: and mourning as the owls.
Isa 20:4: So will the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians prisoners: and the Ethiopians captives: young and old: naked and barefoot: even with their buttocks uncovered: to the shame of Egypt.
Isa 47:2: 3: Take the millstones: and grind meal: uncover your locks: make bare the leg: uncover the thigh: pass over the rivers.
Jer 13:22: If you say in your heart: For what reason come these things upon me? For the greatness of your iniquity are your skirts discovered: and your heels made bare.
Eze 16:37: Look: therefore I will gather all your lovers: with whom you have taken pleasure: and all them that you have loved: with all them that you have hated; I will even gather them round about against you: and will discover your nakedness to them: that they may see all your nakedness.
Na 3:5: Look: I am against you: says the LORD of hosts; and I will discover your skirts upon your face: and I will show the nations your nakedness: and the kingdoms your shame.

 כִּֽי־חָ֥לָֽה לְטֹ֖וב יֹושֶׁ֣בֶת מָרֹ֑ות כִּֽי־יָ֤רַד רָע֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה לְשַׁ֖עַר יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj
H2470חָ֥לָֽהḥā-lāh   (V-Qal-Perf-3fs)
H2470 חָלָה châlâh khaw-law a primitive root (compare חוּל, חָלָה, חָלַל); properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat; beseech, (be) diseased, (put to) grief, be grieved, (be) grievous, infirmity, intreat, lay to, put to pain, idiom pray, make prayer, be (fall, make) sick, sore, be sorry, make suit (idiom supplication), woman in travail, be (become) weak, be wounded. 		חָ֥לָֽהḥā-lāh pined V-Qal-Perf-3fs

12 For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD to the gate of Jerusalem.Micah 1:12
Stats
Rank: #4406 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 116 characters, 20 words, 94 letters, 37 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־חָ֥לָֽה לְטֹ֖וב יֹושֶׁ֣בֶת מָרֹ֑ות כִּֽי־יָ֤רַד רָע֙ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה לְשַׁ֖עַר יְרוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: For pined for good the inhabitant of Maroth but came down disaster from Yahweh to the gate of Jerusalem

KJV: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD unto the gate of Jerusalem.
References

"Maroth"
Ru 1:20: She said to them: Call not me Naomi: call me Mara: for the Almighty has dealt very bitterly with me.

"waited carefully"
1Sa 4:13: When He came: indeed: Eli sat upon a seat by the wayside watching: for His heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city: and told it: all the city cried out.
Job 30:26: When I looked for good: then evil came to me: and when I waited for light: there came darkness.
Isa 59:9-11: Therefore is judgment far from us: neither does justice overtake us: we wait for light: but look obscurity; for brightness: but we walk in darkness.
Jer 8:15: We looked for peace: but no good came; and for a time of health: and look trouble!
Jer 14:19: Have you utterly rejected Judah? has your soul lothed Zion? why have you smitten us: and there is no healing for us? we looked for peace: and there is no good; and for the time of healing: and look trouble!

"but"
Mic 1:9: For her wound is incurable; for it is come to Judah; he is come to the gate of my people: even to Jerusalem.
Isa 45:7: I form the light: and create darkness: I make peace: and create evil: I the LORD do all these things.
Am 3:6: Will a trumpet be blown in the city: and the not people be afraid? will there be evil in a city: and the LORD has not done it?

13 O you inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: she is the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: for the transgressions of Israel were found in you.Micah 1:13
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: רְתֹ֧ם הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֛ה לָרֶ֖כֶשׁ יֹושֶׁ֣בֶת לָכִ֑ישׁ רֵאשִׁ֨ית חַטָּ֥את הִיא֙ לְבַת־צִיֹּ֔ון כִּי־בָ֥ךְ נִמְצְא֖וּ פִּשְׁעֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

Lit: Harness the chariot to the swift steeds inhabitant of Lachish the beginning of sin she was to the daughter of Zion for in you were found the transgressions of Israel

KJV: O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: she is the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: for the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.

Translation
Hebrew: קָרְחִ֣י וָגֹ֔זִּי עַל־בְּנֵ֖י תַּעֲנוּגָ֑יִךְ הַרְחִ֤בִי קָרְחָתֵךְ֙ כַּנֶּ֔שֶׁר כִּ֥י גָל֖וּ מִמֵּֽךְ׃ ס

Lit: Make yourself bald and cut off your hair because of children your precious Enlarge your baldness like an eagle for they shall go into captivity from you

KJV: Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; enlarge thy baldness as the eagle; for they are gone into captivity from thee.

"bald"

Isa 15:2: He is gone up to Bajith: and to Dibon: the high places: to weep: Moab will howl over Nebo: and over Medeba: on all their heads will be baldness: and every beard cut off.
Isa 22:12: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Jer 6:26: O daughter of my people: gird you with sackcloth: and wallow yourself in ashes: make you mourning: as for an only son: most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler will suddenly come upon us.
Jer 7:29: Cut off your hair: O Jerusalem: and cast it away: and take up a lamentation on high places; for the LORD has rejected and forsaken the generation of His wrath.
Jer 16:6: Both the great and the small will die in this land: they will not be buried: neither will men lament for them: nor cut themselves: nor make themselves bald for them:
Am 8:10: I will turn your feasts into mourning: and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins: and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son: and the end thereof as a bitter day.

"thy delicate"
De 28:56: 57: The tender and delicate woman among you: which not would adventure to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness: her eye will be evil toward the husband of her bosom: and toward her son: and toward her daughter:
Isa 3:16-26: Moreover the LORD says: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty: and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes: walking and mincing as they go: and making a tinkling with their feet:
La 4:5-8: They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets: they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.

"for"
De 28:41: You will beget sons and daughters: but you will not enjoy them; for they will go into captivity.
2Ki 17:6: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria: and carried Israel away into Assyria: and placed them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan: and in the cities of the Medes.
Isa 39:6: 7: Look: the days come: that all that is in your house: and that which your fathers have laid up in store until this day: will be carried to Babylon: nothing will be left: says the LORD.

2
Woe to Oppressors

הֹ֧וי חֹֽשְׁבֵי־אָ֛וֶן וּפֹ֥עֲלֵי רָ֖ע עַל־מִשְׁכְּבֹותָ֑ם בְּאֹ֤ור הַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ יַעֲשׂ֔וּהָ כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֖ל יָדָֽם׃

StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H1945ה֧וֹיhō-w   (Interjection)
H1945 הוֹי hôwy hohee a prolonged form of הוֹ (akin to אוֹי); oh!; ah, alas, ho, O, woe. 		ה֧וֹיhō-w Woe Interjection
H2803חֹֽשְׁבֵי־ḥō-šə-ḇê-   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-mpc)
H2803 חָשַׁב châshab khaw-shab a primitive root; properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute; (make) account (of), conceive, consider, count, cunning (man, work, workman), devise, esteem, find out, forecast, hold, imagine, impute, invent, be like, mean, purpose, reckon(-ing be made), regard, think. 		חֹֽשְׁבֵי־ḥō-šə-ḇê- to those who devise V-Qal-Prtcpl-mpc
H205אָ֛וֶן’ā-wen   (N-ms)

1 Woe to them that devise iniquity, and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light, they practise it, because it is in the power of their hand.Micah 2:1
Stats
Rank: #8935 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 151 characters, 25 words, 118 letters, 46 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֹ֧וי חֹֽשְׁבֵי־אָ֛וֶן וּפֹ֥עֲלֵי רָ֖ע עַל־מִשְׁכְּבֹותָ֑ם בְּאֹ֤ור הַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ יַעֲשׂ֔וּהָ כִּ֥י יֶשׁ־לְאֵ֖ל יָדָֽם׃

Lit: Woe to those who devise iniquity and work out evil on their beds at light morning they practice it because it is in the power of their hand

KJV: Woe to them that devise iniquity, and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light, they practise it, because it is in the power of their hand.
References

"to"
Es 3:8: Haman said to king Ahasuerus: There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of your kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.
Es 5:14: Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends to him: Let a gallows be made of 50 cubits high: and to morrow speak you to the king that Mordecai may be hanged thereon: then go you in merrily with the king to the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.
Es 9:25: But when Esther came before the king: he commanded by letters that his wicked device: which he devised against the Jews: should return upon his own head: and that he and his sons should be hanged on the gallows.
Ps 7:14-16: Look: he travails with iniquity: and has conceived mischief: and brought forth falsehood.
Ps 140:1-8: A Psalm of David.>> Deliver me: O LORD: from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;
Pr 6:12-19: A naughty person: a wicked man: walks with a froward mouth.
Pr 12:2: A good man obtains favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will He condemn.
Isa 32:7: The instruments also of the churl are evil: he devises wicked devices to destroy the poor with lying words: even when the needy speaks right.
Isa 59:3: For your hands are defiled with blood: and your fingers with iniquity; your lips have spoken lies: your tongue has muttered perverseness.
Jer 18:18: Then said they: Come: and let us devise devices against Jeremiah; for the law will not perish from the priest: nor counsel from the wise: nor the word from the prophet. Come: and let us smite him with the tongue: and let not us give heed to any of his words.
Eze 11:2: Then said He to me: Son of man: these are the men that devise mischief: and give wicked counsel in this city:
Na 1:11: There is one come out of you: that imagines evil against the LORD: a wicked counseller.
Lu 20:19: The chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him; and they feared the people: for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them.
Lu 22:2-6: The chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.
Ac 23:12: When it was day: certain of the Jews banded together: and bound themselves under a curse: saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
Ro 1:30: Backbiters: haters of God: despiteful: proud: boasters: inventors of evil things: disobedient to parents:

"work"
Ps 36:4: He devises mischief upon his bed; he sets himself in a way that is not good; he abhors not evil.
Pr 4:16: For they not sleep: except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away: unless they cause some to fall.

"when"
Ho 7:6: 7: For they have made ready their heart like an oven: while they lie in wait: their baker sleeps all the night; in the morning it burns as a flaming fire.
Mt 27:1: 2: When the morning was come: all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put Him to death:
Mr 15:1: Straightway in the morning the chief priests held a consultation with the elders and scribes and the whole council: and bound Jesus: and carried Him away: and delivered Him to Pilate.
Ac 23:15: Now therefore you with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down to you to morrow: as though you would inquire something more perfectly concerning him: and we: or ever he come near: are ready to kill him.

"because"
Ge 31:29: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spoke to me last night: saying: Take you heed that you not speak to Jacob either good or bad.
De 28:32: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people: and your eyes will look: and fail with longing for them all the day long: and there will be no might in your hand.
Pr 3:27: not Withhold good from them to whom it is due: when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
Joh 19:11: Jesus answered: You could have no power at all against me: except it were given you from above: therefore He that'>He who delivered me to you has the greater sin.

2 They covet fields, and take them by violence; and houses, and take them away: so they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage.Micah 2:2
Stats
Counts: 149 characters, 22 words, 113 letters, 45 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְחָמְד֤וּ שָׂדֹות֙ וְגָזָ֔לוּ וּבָתִּ֖ים וְנָשָׂ֑אוּ וְעָֽשְׁקוּ֙ גֶּ֣בֶר וּבֵיתֹ֔ו וְאִ֖ישׁ וְנַחֲלָתֹֽו׃ פ

Lit: And they covet fields and take them by violence and houses and seize them so they oppress a man and his house and a man and his inheritance

KJV: And they covet fields, and take them by violence; and houses, and take [them] away: so they oppress a man and his house, even a man and his heritage.
References

"they covet"
Ex 20:17: You will not covet your neighbour's house: you will not covet your neighbour's wife: nor his manservant: nor his maidservant: nor his ox: nor his ass: nor any thing that is your neighbour's.
1Ki 21:2-19: Ahab spoke to Naboth: saying: Give me your vineyard: that I may have it for a garden of herbs: because it is near to my house: and I will give you for it a better vineyard than it; or: if it seem good to you: I will give you the worth of it in money.
Job 31:38: If my land cry against me: or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
Isa 5:8: Woe to them that join house to house: that lay field to field: till there be no place: that they may be placed alone in the middle of the earth!
Jer 22:17: But your eyes and your heart are not but for your covetousness: and for to shed innocent blood: and for oppression: and for violence: to do it.
Am 8:4: Hear this: O you that swallow up the needy: even to make the poor of the land to fail:
Hab 2:5-9: Yes also: because he transgresss by wine: he is a proud man: neither keeps at home: who enlarges his desire as hell: and is as death: and cannot be satisfied: but gathers to him all nations: and heaps to him all people:
1Ti 6:10: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after: they have erred from the faith: and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

"so"
Mic 3:9: Hear this: I pray you: you heads of the house of Jacob: and princes of the house of Israel: that abhor judgment: and pervert all equity.
Ex 22:21-24: You will neither vex a stranger: nor oppress him: for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
2Ki 9:26: Surely I have seen yesterday the blood of Naboth: and the blood of His sons: says the LORD; and I will requite you in this plat: says the LORD. Now therefore take and cast Him into the plat of ground: according to the word of the LORD.
Ne 5:1-5: There was a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.
Job 24:2-12: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks: and feed thereof.
Eze 18:12: Has oppressed the poor and needy: has spoiled by violence: has not restored the pledge: and has lifted up his eyes to the idols: has committed abomination:
Eze 22:12: In you have they taken gifts to shed blood; you have taken usury and increase: and you have greedily gained of your neighbours by extortion: and have forgotten me: says the Lord GOD.
Am 8:4: Hear this: O you that swallow up the needy: even to make the poor of the land to fail:
Mal 3:5: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers: and against the adulterers: and against false swearers: and against those that oppress the hireling in His wages: the widow: and the fatherless: and that turn aside the stranger from His right: and not fear me: says the LORD of hosts.
Mt 23:14: Woe to you: scribes and Pharisees: hypocrites! for you devour widows' houses: and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore you will receive the greater damnation.

"oppress"
1Sa 12:3: 4: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.

 לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י חֹשֵׁ֛ב עַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את רָעָ֑ה אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹֽא־תָמִ֨ישׁוּ מִשָּׁ֜ם צַוְּארֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְלֹ֤א תֵֽלְכוּ֙ רֹומָ֔ה כִּ֛י עֵ֥ת רָעָ֖ה הִֽיא׃

H3651לָכֵ֗ןlā-ḵên,   (Adv)

H3541 כֹּה kôh ko from the prefix k and הוּא; properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now; also, here, + hitherto, like, on the other side, so (and much), such, on that manner, (on) this (manner, side, way, way and that way), + mean while, yonder., 		כֹּ֚הkōh thus Adv
H559אָמַ֣ר’ā-mar   (V-Qal-Perf-3ms)

H1931הִֽיא׃hî.   (Pro-3fs)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הִֽיא׃hî. that is Pro-3fs
3 Therefore thus says the LORD; Look, against this family do I devise an evil, from which you will not remove your necks; neither will you go haughtily: for this time is evil.Micah 2:3
Stats
Rank: #4267 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 176 characters, 27 words, 139 letters, 52 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה הִנְנִ֥י חֹשֵׁ֛ב עַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את רָעָ֑ה אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹֽא־תָמִ֨ישׁוּ מִשָּׁ֜ם צַוְּארֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְלֹ֤א תֵֽלְכוּ֙ רֹומָ֔ה כִּ֛י עֵ֥ת רָעָ֖ה הִֽיא׃

Lit: Therefore thus says Yahweh behold I am devising against family this disaster which cannot you remove from your necks nor shall you walk haughtily for time an evil that is

KJV: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, against this family do I devise an evil, from which ye shall not remove your necks; neither shall ye go haughtily: for this time is evil.
References

"this family"
Jer 8:3: Death will be chosen rather than life by all the residue of them that remain of this evil family: which remain in all the places whither I have driven them: says the LORD of hosts.
Am 3:1: 2: Hear this word that the LORD has spoken against you: O children of Israel: against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt: saying:

"do"
Mic 2:1: Woe to them that devise iniquity: and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light: they practise it: because it is in the power of their hand.
Jer 18:11: Now therefore go to: speak to the men of Judah: and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem: saying: Thus says the LORD; Look: I frame evil against you: and devise a device against you: return you now every one from His evil way: and make your ways and your doings good.
Jer 34:17: Therefore thus says the LORD; You not have listened to me: in proclaiming liberty: every one to His brother: and every man to His neighbour: look: I proclaim a liberty for you: says the LORD: to the sword: to the pestilence: and to the famine; and I will make you to be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
La 2:17: The LORD has done that which He had devised; He has fulfilled His word that He had commanded in the days of old: He has thrown down: and has not pitied: and He has caused your enemy to rejoice over you: He has set up the horn of your adversaries.
Jas 2:13: For he will have judgment without mercy: that has showed no mercy; and mercy rejoices against judgment.

"from"
Am 2:14-16: Therefore the flight will perish from the swift: and the strong will not strengthen his force: neither will the mighty deliver himself:
Am 9:1-4: I saw the Lord standing upon the altar: and He said: Smite the lintel of the door: that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head: all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: He that'>He who flees of them will not flee away: and He that'>He who escapes of them will not be delivered.
Zep 1:17: 18: I will bring distress upon men: that they will walk like blind men: because they have sinned against the LORD: and their blood will be poured out as dust: and their flesh as the dung.

"necks"
Jer 27:12: I spoke also to Zedekiah king of Judah according to all these words: saying: Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon: and serve him and his people: and live.
La 1:14: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by His hand: they are wreathed: and come up upon my neck: He has made my strength to fall: the Lord has delivered me into their hands: from whom I not am able to rise up.
La 5:5: Our necks are under persecution: we labour: and have no rest.
Ro 16:4: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: to not whom only I give thanks: but also all the churches of the Gentiles.

"go"
Isa 2:11: 12: The lofty looks of man will be humbled: and the haughtiness of men will be bowed down: and the LORD alone will be exalted in that day.
Isa 3:16: Moreover the LORD says: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty: and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton eyes: walking and mincing as they go: and making a tinkling with their feet:
Isa 5:19: That say: Let Him make speed: and hasten His work: that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy one of Israel draw nigh and come: that we may know it!
Isa 28:14-18: For what reason hear the word of the LORD: you scornful men: that rule this people which is in Jerusalem.
Jer 13:15-17: Hear you: and give ear; not be proud: for the LORD has spoken.
Jer 36:23: It came to pass: that when Jehudi had read 3 or 4 leaves: he cut it with the penknife: and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth: until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.
Jer 43:2: Then spoke Azariah the son of Hoshaiah: and Johanan the son of Kareah: and all the proud men: saying to Jeremiah: You speak falsely: the LORD our God has not sent you to say: not Go into Egypt to sojourn there:
Da 4:37: Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour the King of heaven: all whose works are truth: and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase.
Da 5:20-23: But when his heart was lifted up: and his mind hardened in pride: he was deposed from his kingly throne: and they took his glory from him:

"for"
Am 5:13: Therefore the prudent will keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.
Eph 5:16: Redeeming the time: because the days are evil.

 בַּיֹּ֨ום הַה֜וּא יִשָּׂ֧א עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם מָשָׁ֗ל וְנָהָ֨ה נְהִ֤י נִֽהְיָה֙ אָמַר֙ שָׁדֹ֣וד נְשַׁדֻּ֔נוּ חֵ֥לֶק עַמִּ֖י יָמִ֑יר אֵ֚יךְ יָמִ֣ישׁ לִ֔י לְשֹׁובֵ֥ב שָׂדֵ֖ינוּ יְחַלֵּֽק׃

H3117בַּיּ֨וֹםbay-yō-wm   (Prep-b, Art | N-ms)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		בַּיּ֨וֹםbay-yō-wm In day Prep-b, Art | N-ms

He has divided V-Piel-Imperf-3ms
4 In that day will one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, and say, We be utterly spoiled: he has changed the portion of my people: how has he removed it from me! turning away he has divided our fields.Micah 2:4
Stats
Rank: #5777 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 242 characters, 36 words, 187 letters, 74 vowels, 113 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּיֹּ֨ום הַה֜וּא יִשָּׂ֧א עֲלֵיכֶ֣ם מָשָׁ֗ל וְנָהָ֨ה נְהִ֤י נִֽהְיָה֙ אָמַר֙ שָׁדֹ֣וד נְשַׁדֻּ֔נוּ חֵ֥לֶק עַמִּ֖י יָמִ֑יר אֵ֚יךְ יָמִ֣ישׁ לִ֔י לְשֹׁובֵ֥ב שָׂדֵ֖ינוּ יְחַלֵּֽק׃

Lit: In day that one shall take up against you a proverb and lament with a lamentation bitter saying utterly we are destroyed the heritage of my people He has changed how He has removed it from me to a turncoat our fields He has divided

KJV: In that day shall one take up a parable against you, and lament with a doleful lamentation, [and] say, We be utterly spoiled: he hath changed the portion of my people: how hath he removed [it] from me! turning away he hath divided our fields.
References

"shall"
Nu 23:7: 18: He took up his parable: and said: Balak the king of Moab has brought me from Aram: out of the mountains of the east: saying: Come: curse me Jacob: and come: defy Israel.
Nu 24:3: 15: He took up his parable: and said: Balaam the son of Beor has said: and the man whose eyes are open has said:
Job 27:1: Moreover Job continued his parable: and said:
Isa 14:4: That you will take up this proverb against the king of Babylon: and say: How has the oppressor ceased! the golden city ceased!
Eze 16:44: Look: every one that uss proverbs will use this proverb against you: saying: As is the mother: so is her daughter.
Hab 2:6: Will not all these take up a parable against him: and a taunting proverb against him: and say: Woe to him that increases that which is not his! how long? and to him that lads himself with thick clay!
Mr 12:12: They sought to lay hold on him: but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him: and went their way.

"and lament"
2Sa 1:17: David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:
2Ch 35:25: Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing men and the singing women spoke of Josiah in their lamentations to this day: and made them an ordinance in Israel: and: look: they are written in the lamentations.
Jer 9:10: 17-21: For the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing: and for the habitations of the wilderness a lamentation: because they are burned up: so that none can pass through them; neither can men hear the voice of the cattle; both the fowl of the heavens and the beast are fled; they are gone.
Jer 14:18: If I go forth into the field: then look the killed with the sword! and if I enter into the city: then look them that are sick with famine! yes: both the prophet and the priest go about into a land that they not know.
Joe 1:8: 13: Lament like a virgin girded with sackcloth for the husband of her youth.
Am 5:1: 17: Hear you this word which I take up against you: even a lamentation: O house of Israel.

"a doleful lamentation"
La 1:1-5: How does the city sit solitary: that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations: and princess among the provinces: how is she become tributary!
Eze 2:10: He spread it before me; and it was written within and without: and there was written therein lamentations: and mourning: and woe.

"We"
De 28:29: you will grope at noonday: as the blind gropes in darkness: and you will not prosper in your ways: and you will be only oppressed and spoiled evermore: and no man will save you.
Isa 6:11: Then said I: Lord: how long? And He answered: Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant: and the houses without man: and the land be utterly desolate:
Isa 24:3: The land will be utterly emptied: and utterly spoiled: for the LORD has spoken this word.
Jer 9:19: For a voice of wailing is heard out of Zion: How are we spoiled! we are greatly confounded: because we have forsaken the land: because our dwellings have cast us out.
Jer 25:9-11: Look: I will send and take all the families of the north: says the LORD: and Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon: my servant: and will bring them against this land: and against the inhabitants thereof: and against all these nations round about: and will utterly destroy them: and make them an astonishment: and an hissing: and perpetual desolations.
Zep 1:2: I will utterly consume all things from off the land: says the LORD.

"he hath changed"
Mic 2:10: Arise you: and depart; for this is not your rest: because it is polluted: it will destroy you: even with a sore destruction.
Mic 1:15: Yet will I bring an heir to you: O inhabitant of Mareshah: he will come to Adullam the glory of Israel.
2Ki 17:23: 24: Until the LORD removed Israel out of His sight: as He had said by all His servants the prophets. So was Israel carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.
2Ch 36:20: 21: Them that had escaped from the sword carried he away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:
Isa 63:17: 18: O LORD: why have you made us to err from your ways: and hardened our heart from your fear? Return for your servants' sake: the tribes of your inheritance.

Lit: Therefore no one will have you to determine boundaries by lot in the assembly of Yahweh

KJV: Therefore thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in the congregation of the LORD.

Reproof of False Prophets

6 Prophesy you not, say they to them that prophesy: they will not prophesy to them, that they will not take shame.Micah 2:6
Stats
Rank: #6496 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 115 characters, 17 words, 89 letters, 26 vowels, 63 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תַּטִּ֖פוּ יַטִּיפ֑וּן לֹֽא־יַטִּ֣פוּ לָאֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א יִסַּ֖ג כְּלִמֹּֽות׃

Lit: Not do prattle you say to those who prophesy not so they shall prophesy to these not they shall return insult for insult

KJV: Prophesy ye not, say they to them that prophesy: they shall not prophesy to them, [that] they shall not take shame.
References

"Prophesy ye, etc"

Am 7:13: But not prophesy again any more at Bethel: for it is the king's chapel: and it is the king's court.
Ac 4:17: But that it spread no further among the people: let us straitly threaten them: that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.

Ac 7:51: You stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears: you do always resist the Holy Ghost: as your fathers did: so do you.
1Th 2:15: 16: Who both killed the Lord Jesus: and their own prophets: and have persecuted us; and they not please God: and are contrary to all men:

"they shall not prophesy"

"that they"

7 O you that are named the house of Jacob, is the spirit of the LORD straitened? are these His doings? not do my words do good to Him that walks uprightly?Micah 2:7
Stats
Rank: #7940 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 158 characters, 27 words, 122 letters, 45 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֶאָמ֣וּר בֵּֽית־יַעֲקֹ֗ב הֲקָצַר֙ ר֣וּחַ יְהוָ֔ה אִם־אֵ֖לֶּה מַעֲלָלָ֑יו הֲלֹ֤וא דְבָרַ֨י יֵיטִ֔יבוּ עִ֖ם הַיָּשָׁ֥ר הֹולֵֽךְ׃

Lit: You who are named the house of Jacob is restricted the Spirit of Yahweh Are these His doings do not My words do good to uprightly him who walks

KJV: O thou that art named the house of Jacob, is the spirit of the LORD straitened? [are] these his doings? do not my words do good to him that walketh uprightly?
References

"named"
Mic 3:9: Hear this: I pray you: you heads of the house of Jacob: and princes of the house of Israel: that abhor judgment: and pervert all equity.
Isa 48:1: 2: Hear you this: O house of Jacob: which are called by the name of Israel: and are come forth out of the waters of Judah: which swear by the name of the LORD: and make mention of the God of Israel: but not in truth: nor in righteousness.
Isa 58:1: Cry aloud: not spare: lift up your voice like a trumpet: and show my people their transgression: and the house of Jacob their sins.
Jer 2:4: Hear you the word of the LORD: O house of Jacob: and all the families of the house of Israel:
Mt 3:8: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:
Joh 8:39: They answered and said to Him: Abraham is our father. Jesus says to them: If you were Abraham's children: you would do the works of Abraham.
Ro 2:28: 29: For he not is a Jew: which is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision: which is outward in the flesh:
Ro 9:6-13: Not as though the word of God has taken none effect. For they are not all Israel: which are of Israel:
2Ti 3:5: Having a form of godliness: but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

"is"
Nu 11:23: The LORD said to Moses: Is the LORD's hand waxed short? you will see now whether my word will come to pass to you not or.
Isa 50:2: For what reason: when I came: was there no man? when I called: was there none to answer? Is my hand shortened at all: that it cannot redeem? or have I no power to deliver? look: at my rebuke I dry up the sea: I make the rivers a wilderness: their fish stinks: because there is no water: and dies for thirst.
Isa 59:1: 2: Look: the LORD's hand not is shortened: that it cannot save; neither His ear heavy: that it cannot hear:
Zec 4:6: Then He answered and spoke to me: saying: This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: saying: Not by might: nor by power: but by my spirit: says the LORD of hosts.
2Co 6:12: You not are straitened in us: but you are straitened in your own bowels.

"do not"
Ps 19:7-11: The law of the LORD is perfect: converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure: making wise the simple.
Ps 119:70: 71: 92: 93: 99-103: Their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in your law.
Jer 15:16: Your words were found: and I did eat them; and your word was to me the joy and rejoicing of my heart: for I am called by your name: O LORD God of hosts.
Ro 7:13: Was then that which is good made death to me? God forbid. But sin: that it might appear sin: working death in me by that which is good; that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful.

"walketh"
Ps 15:2: He who walks uprightly: and works righteousness: and speaks the truth in his heart.
Ps 84:11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.
Pr 2:7: He lays up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
Pr 10:9: 29: He who walks'>walks uprightly walks'>walks surely: but he who perverts his ways will be known.
Pr 14:2: He who walks in His uprightness fears the LORD: but He that'>He who is perverse in His ways despises Him.
Pr 28:18: Whoever walks uprightly will be saved: but he who is perverse in his ways will fall at once.
Ho 14:9: Who is wise: and He will understand these things? prudent: and He will know them? for the ways of the LORD are right: and the just will walk in them: but the transgressors will fall therein.

8 Even of late my people is risen up as an enemy: you pull off the robe with the garment from them that pass by securely as men averse from war.Micah 2:8
Stats
Rank: #7939 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 141 characters, 29 words, 110 letters, 40 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאֶתְמ֗וּל עַמִּי֙ לְאֹויֵ֣ב יְקֹומֵ֔ם מִמּ֣וּל שַׂלְמָ֔ה אֶ֖דֶר תַּפְשִׁט֑וּן מֵעֹבְרִ֣ים בֶּ֔טַח שׁוּבֵ֖י מִלְחָמָֽה׃

Lit: and Lately My people as an enemy have risen up with the garment the magnificence You pull off from as they pass by those who trust you Like men returned from war

KJV: Even of late my people is risen up as an enemy: ye pull off the robe with the garment from them that pass by securely as men averse from war.

H5769לְעוֹלָֽם׃lə-‘ō-w-lām.   (Prep-l | N-ms)
H5769 עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm o-lawm or עֹלָם; from עָלַם; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always; alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world (phrase without end). 9 The women of my people have you cast out from their pleasant houses; from their children have you taken away my glory for ever.Micah 2:9
Stats
Rank: #8711 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 23 words, 100 letters, 38 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: נְשֵׁ֤י עַמִּי֙ תְּגָ֣רְשׁ֔וּן מִבֵּ֖ית תַּֽעֲנֻגֶ֑יהָ מֵעַל֙ עֹֽלָלֶ֔יהָ תִּקְח֥וּ הֲדָרִ֖י לְעֹולָֽם׃

Lit: The women of My people you cast out from houses their pleasant from their children You have taken away My glory forever

KJV: The women of my people have ye cast out from their pleasant houses; from their children have ye taken away my glory for ever.
References

"cast"
Mic 2:2: They covet fields: and take them by violence; and houses: and take them away: so they oppress a man and his house: even a man and his heritage.
Mt 23:14: Woe to you: scribes and Pharisees: hypocrites! for you devour widows' houses: and for a pretence make long prayer: therefore you will receive the greater damnation.
Mr 12:40: Which devour widows' houses: and for a pretence make long prayers: these will receive greater damnation.
Lu 20:47: Which devour widows' houses: and for a show make long prayers: the same will receive greater damnation.

"from their children"
1Sa 26:19: Now therefore: I pray you: let my lord the king hear the words of His servant. If the LORD have stirred you up against me: let Him accept an offering: but if they be the children of men: cursed be they before the LORD; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the LORD: saying: Go: serve other gods.
Joe 3:6: The children also of Judah and the children of Jerusalem have you sold to the Grecians: that you might remove them far from their border.

"my glory"
Ps 72:19: Blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen: and Amen.
Eze 39:21: I will set my glory among the heathen: and all the heathen will see my judgment that I have executed: and my hand that I have laid upon them.
Hab 2:14: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD: as the waters cover the sea.
Zec 2:5: For I: says the LORD: will be to her a wall of fire round about: and will be the glory in the middle of her.
2Co 3:18: But we all: with open face beholding as in a glass the glory of the Lord: are changed into the same image from glory to glory: even as by the Spirit of the Lord.
2Co 4:6: For God: who commanded the light to shine out of darkness: has shined in our hearts: to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Lit: Arise and depart for not this is your rest because it is defiled it shall destroy and Yes with destruction utter

KJV: Arise ye, and depart; for this is not [your] rest: because it is polluted, it shall destroy [you], even with a sore destruction.

"and"

De 30:18: I denounce to you this day: that you will surely perish: and that you will not prolong your days upon the land: whither you pass over Jordan to go to possess it.

"for"

"because"

"it shall"

Eze 36:12-14: Yes: I will cause men to walk upon you: even my people Israel; and they will possess you: and you will be their inheritance: and you will no more henceforth bereave them of men.

H376אִ֞ישׁ’îš   (N-ms)
